719202f-a.title: Manhattan: Cooper Square (North) - 4th Street.
719202f-a.text:
14-30 Cooper Square, west side, north from but not including East 4th Street, to but not including Astor Place.
January 10, 1928.
Edwin Levick.
Neg. #1974

716795f-b.title: Manhattan: Bowery - 4th Street (East)
716795f-b.text:
Bowery, east side, north from East 3rd, to and including East 4th Streets. Also shown is Cooper Square East, north from and including East 4th, to and including East 6th Streets. Cooper Union Institute is shown facing Cooper Square on East 6th Street. From left to right, across the skyline is seen the Empire State, the Metropolitan Life Insurance, Cooper Union and the Consolidated Gas Company buildings. A unit of the Salvation Army is shown adjoining the N.E. corner of
East 3rd Street.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the N.E. corner of East 3rd Street.

716795f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - 4th Street (East)
716795f-a.text:
Bowery, east side, north from East 3rd, to and including East 4th Streets. Also shown is Cooper Square East, north from and including East 4th, to and including East 6th Streets. Cooper Union Institute is shown facing Cooper Square on East 6th Street. From left to right, across the skyline is seen the Empire State, the Metropolitan Life Insurance, Cooper Union and the Consolidated Gas Company buildings. A unit of the Salvation Army is shown adjoining the N.E. corner of
East 3rd Street.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the N.E. corner of East 3rd Street.

716797f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - 4th Street (East)
716797f-a.text:
(1)
Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of East 4th Street. No. 361 Bowery, at the S.E. corner of East 4th Street, is a frame house.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a different date.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 142.
(3)
The same.
February, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)
Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of East 4th Street. No. 361 Bowery, at the S.E. corner of East 4th Street, is a frame house.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)

1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 142.
(3)

716797f-b.text:
(1)
Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of East 4th Street. No. 361 Bowery, at the S.E. corner of East 4th Street, is a frame house.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

1932.

716798f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - 4th Street (East)
716798f-a.text:
Bowery, east side, north from, but not including East 4th Street.
Shown in the background, is the Cooper Institute.
March 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

716796f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - 4th Street (East)
716796f-a.text:
The Bowery,south from E. 4th Street showing the northern extremity of this famous thoroughfare. The photographer is standing at Cooper Square where 3rd and 4th Ave's begin their existance. The intersecting street in the forground is 4th St.
February 4, 1937
W.P.A. Photo.
Five Boroughs Vroject

719204f-a.title: Manhattan: Cooper Square (North) - 4th Street (East).
719204f-a.text:
Cooper Square, north from E. 4th Street. In the center is Cooper Union Institute with a small triangular park preceding same. At this point begins two of Manhattans important thorough fares, Fourth Ave. (left; to Astor Place) & 3rd Ave.
(right), which emanate from the Bowery.
February 4, 1937
W.P.A. Photo.
Five Boroughs Project,

710886f-a.title: Manhattan: 4th Street - Bowery
710886f-a.text:
East 4th Street, at, adjoining and west of the S.W. corner of the Bowery. Note the Third Ave., Elevated on the Bowery.
March 24, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

710894f-a.title: Manhattan: 4th Street - Cooper Square
710894f-a.text:
37 East 4th Street, north side, west of Cooper Square (The
Bowery).
August 7, 1937.
0ift of Geo. D. Chinn.
